result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:57 - 4:01 PM Defendant Riley Alan Grawien in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger in court for Riley Alan Grawien.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 950 complied with. State informs the Court a offer was previously extended, not sure why Atty Collier is not here on deft's other cases (21CT209 / 21CM471). Off the record for Atty Jaeger to meet with client.
Back on the record at 4:45 PM all parties the same and Atty Jaeger has a signed Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights. Court will have judicial asst set new date after getting a hold of Atty Collier.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 3, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Scheduling conference on November 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Riley Alan Grawien appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger appeared by phone for Riley Alan Grawien.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing questionnaire & waiver filed. Probable Cause Found, Defendant bound over.
Information filed/reading waived, Not guilty plea entered all Counts.

Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
